Author: mya9198
Content: Aku pro soalnya transum menjadi sendi kehidupan baik susah, senang, pahit, dan semuanya ada di situ. Seseorang hidup dengan transum adalah sebuah kenyataan yang menarik karena sudah ikut turut mengurangi pemanasan global, membantu kesehatan masyarakat, dan turut menjaga lingkungan. Jadi tentang transum yang seharusnya menjadi perhatian terbesar bagi pemerintah karena menjadi kunci keberhasilan dalam kemajuan kotanya terutama di transportasi umum Jakarta yang mana ada berbagai moda transportasi yang mumpuni dan menjadi perhatian besar agar tingkatkan lagi pelayanan baik penambahan jumlah armada kendaraannya, fasilitas yang terjamin, penambahan koridor lanjutan, memberikan akses yang mudah, dan mengutamakan pembangunan khusus jalan bagi transum. Apalagi di situ ada prioritas wanita, warga lanjut usia, dan penyandang disabilitas yang mana harus dikhususkan tempatnya dengan syarat berikan kenyamanan dan keamanan dalam pelayanan yang seharusnya menjadi perhatian besar bagi pemerintahnya ke depannya.

Author: monke_eat_banana
Content:
PRO:
Dewan akan mengambil *penyadang disabilitas* sebagai metrik penentuan apakah semua transportasi umum di Jakarta pada saat ini memenuhi standar.

Dengan asumsi:
Transportasi Umum = { MRT, LRT, TransJakarta, JakLingko }

Untuk transportasi umum di Jakarta dianggap **memenuhi standar**, setiap stasiun/halte harus memenuhi kriteria berikut:
> Setiap penumpang penyadang disabilitas dapat pergi dari stasiun/halte A ke stasiun/halte B dan menggunakan seluruh fasilitas utama selayaknya penumpang tanpa disabilitas.

Beberapa bukti menunjukkan bahwa tidak semua stasiun & halte memenuhi kriteria ini:
- Masih terdapat stasiun yang tidak ramah penumpang disabilitas
https://www.tvonenews.com/channel/news/334707-penampakan-halte-jalur-langit-transjakarta-tak-ramah-penumpang-disabilitas
- Gubernur DKI Jakarta sendiri mengaku bahwa tidak semua halte TJ dan stasiun MRT ramah disabilitas
https://megapolitan.kompas.com/read/2025/11/03/12454551/pramono-akui-tak-semua-halte-dan-stasiun-di-jakarta-ramah-disabilitas

```
// comment
Very sad I'm not able to find data on the ramp slope of all the public transport facilities in Jakarta.

According to the ADA Standards, the maximum slope for ramps is 1:12 (~4.8¬∞). Not sure what the standard is for Indonesia.
Ref: https://www.access-board.gov/ada/guides/chapter-4-ramps-and-curb-ramps/

I am absolutely certain most ramps in TJ stations are above 4.8¬∞ in Jakarta, but I'm too socially anxious to actually go and measure them myself.

JakLingko is even worse, but I can't find news report on it and I don't want to manually verify the JakLingko stops
```

Author: .ayab
Content:
Money: In it self has nothing wrong about it, as money  is only a social construct. It is how you use it, how you acquire it, and why you want it is the most important question on anything related to money. Not it position itself within society.

Money as a tool to acquire thing however should be amounted to power, as more people want to sacrifice something of value within them or they have that they are willing to give to you, as such money doesnt acquire you power but money is the side effect of power.

Economy: In my view are juat wants within society that wants ti be fuffiled, a cyclical rotation of power and needs, that cant be regulated or just as power it self is unjust. And to even receive the status of a just and an equal economy it must be maintained by a more powerful entity. True equality will never be achieved as the human condition still view power theatric or real, are the most important thing.

Capitalism: is not a bad system, it is however flawed, however there a re presebtly better alternative for it, question is are the lower and higher class are ready to change how they live their life for an unkonwn system that would change everything so fundamental, as capitalism in my view is just  a written legalized form of human primal want to want anything.

Author: rxsebud
Content:
Do you think the patriarchy system should stay? What is your idea of the patriarchy and do you think it's okay? @Rose‚Äôs Thorns 

I'm especially looking to hear from the men here :smile:

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content:
No, definitely I don't find any good reason for it to stay. 

My idea of patriarchy (if I have to oversimplified it) is basically a system that upheld men in power while the women were largely excluded. It can cover political, social and economic institutions including roles in it.

I will put one simple argument on why I do not think it is okay (even for those who can't understand it by advanced terms): I want my mother and female members of my family to have better treatment by society, so it is logical for me to not support it and propose for a better equal society.

I make this simple, yes money can make you happier but it can also cause trouble if you can't manage yourself. That's why there are a rich person and a poor person. This idea changes people's characteristics 
The economy impacts financial households. If people get into trouble because of financial problems, most efforts to achieve and you have an achievement as a rich person. Author: .ayab
Content:
**First Question**

No, it should not. Using calculative logic and emotional arguments, there is no reason for patriarchy to exist in the modern era. It is an inefficient way to distribute manpower with no strong backing, as a violent-dominated world has been replaced by a bureaucratic one and is no longer ruled by strength.

Calculative:

It is more manpower efficient that women to be a productive member of society, as halving their own manpower potential just because of a role that is no longer as demanding as 200 years ago, without the female workforce, it will be considerably harder to meet industrial demand for workforce, not to mention the bureaucratic toll and need for a literate part of society to be able to crunch number and data is expensive when it comes to human capital. 

Not to mention the foolishness of rejecting 50% of potentially talented human resources to be manifested into an excessively talent-draining role within society, as such, the inclusiveness of the female gender within the structural power of society and filling intensive capital of human resources, both in terms of quantitative and qualitative, is logical and should not be hampered for the advancement of society both on an economic and social lens.

Emotional: 

Bruh, my mum can make you cry with just a glare, and you think you are superior to her ü§®ü§®

so no, there is no place for a patriarchy in a modern setting. But strangely enough, I do support the idea that men must act courteously toward women and treat them with gentleness, even though they are strong without us.

Author: .ayab
Content: No, there should be no domination from either gender; there is nothing wrong with feminism and masculinity, but the toxicity of superiority from either one should be forgotten post haste.

Author: .ayab
Content: My religious view: male and female are equal, but diffrent.

Author: .ayab
Content: All must be given justice without favoring or dismissing the other.

Content:
Essentially patriarchy is a form of society where men are the ones managing power and leadership in hierarchies of society and organization.

Simply patriarchy allows the society to be more efficient, than otherwise - so it is okay for me rather than all societies in the world embracing matriarchy.

Women who sacrifices these will cause babies lose their mom's milk - too much loses compared to men doing these sacrifices.

Content: I think the same as my answer above, it takes various perspectives. We can see activists engaging in movements to create an uprising which is somewhat opposite to the idea of obtaining rights. Speaking of matriarchy, this system must be balanced without partiality. Feminists who have always been there vocalize for grants so that individuals can understand and achieve their rights. Yes, this isn't the end game, we must continue to strive for our achievements. Definitely, there are pros and cons to how this impacts us.

Author: rxsebud
Content:
Context: Permanent membership in the United Nations Security Council refers to the special status held by five states‚ÄîChina, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Permanent members hold their seats indefinitely rather and they possess veto power, meaning they can block the adoption of any substantive Security Council resolution regardless of the level of support from other members. This status gives permanent members a uniquely influential role in decisions relating to sanctions, peacekeeping operations, military intervention, and the recognition of threats to international peace.

**Motion: This house would remove permanent membership status from the UN security council**

Content:
I'm so sorry for being late with this question. Okay, I'll do my best.

There is still a consideration regarding a rule about being related so there is always risk when taking an opportunity, which usually involves removing their status from the UN security council. They're contemplating the substance due to the intentions of the insider who knows about this. It's getting harder and involves factions with different arguments and bad ideas. I don't think it's just a risk concerning their previous agreement. Therefore, there is still an appeal from international media and social media to find out about this. 

Removing permanent membership status is not the only solution to resolve the issue, it also gives the council a chance to consider other perspectives while exploring topics they can observe.

Just to simplify my answer, I hope this can be understood.
